component.text: Click the buttons to see the difference between Layer 2 and MultiLayer switching at the Access Layer.

User No.1 is attempting to access data on the target server through the distribution layer and is being denied. Server 2 is attempting to access the same data on the target server through the Layer 2 access switch and is not denied.
Using multilayer switching at the Access Layer in the server farm can filter locally generated traffic. Now Server 2 can be prevented from accessing data on the target server.
